page.title: 13People and occupations
page.content: In both Pendomer and Halstock the population is fairly mixed, with natives and incomers, retired, working and young people. In Pendomer all those who work are engaged in farming, but a number of Halstock residents commute to Yeovil, where they work for Westland Helicopters or elsewhere. There are local families who have lived in the area for generations, but a number of people - and they include farmers as well as retired folk - have moved here from other areas such as London and the South-East. The people of Halstock enjoy the amenity of a shop and Post Office and a pub and they are also served by a visiting butcher, fishmonger and travelling library; but for more ambitious shopping they travel to Yeovil by car or the weekly bus.
